accussed_details.name: Riazul Hasnain
allegation: Incorrect entry of date of birth in service record

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the incorrect entry of his date of birth in his service record maintained by the P.I. Administration.
investigation_summary: No investigation was conducted as the appeal was deemed premature. The appellant had been representing against the incorrect entry since 1941, but no final decision was made.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed in limine as premature. The appellant was advised to prefer an appeal against any retirement order under subsection (2) of section 20, Civil Servants Act, and subsequently approach the Tribunal as per section 4, Administrative Tribunals Act.
legal_arguments: Subsection (2) of section 20, Civil Servants Act
Paragraph (a) of the proviso to section 4, Administrative Tribunals Act
key_issues: Incorrect date of birth entry in service record

legal_terms.in limine: At the threshold; dismissed without further consideration.

words_and_phrases.premature appeal: An appeal filed before the necessary procedural steps have been completed.

summary_vector_notes: The appellant's grievance regarding the incorrect date of birth entry in his service record was dismissed as premature. The Tribunal emphasized procedural requirements under the Civil Servants Act and Administrative Tribunals Act.
